snippet: A lawyer for five men whose convictions were vacated in 2002 suggested that city lawyers were perhaps seeking to undermine Mayor Bill de Blasio’s call for a prompt resolution of the case.
abstract: Jonathan C Moore, lawyer for men whose convictions in 1989 rape of jogger in Central Park were vacated in 2002, says New York City's lawyers are 'dragging their feet' on settlement talks; suggests city's Law Department may be seeking to undermine Mayor Bill de Blasio's call for a prompt resolution of the case.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for five men whose convictions were vacated in 2002 suggested that city lawyers were perhaps seeking to undermine Mayor Bill de Blasio’s call for a prompt resolution of the case.

headline.main: City Accused of Dragging Its Feet on Settling Suit in ’89 Jogger Rape Case
headline.print_headline: City Accused of Dragging Its Feet on Settling Suit in ’89 Jogger Rape Case
